test-case.name: fn-normalize-space1args-1
test-case.description: Evaluates The "normalize-space" function with the arguments set as follows: $arg = notNormalizedString(lower bound)

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space1args-2
test-case.description: Evaluates The "normalize-space" function with the arguments set as follows: $arg = notNormalizedString(mid range)

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space1args-3
test-case.description: Evaluates The "normalize-space" function with the arguments set as follows: $arg = notNormalizedString(upper bound)

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space1args-4
test-case.description: Test normalize-space with an empty sequence argument

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space0args-1
test-case.description: Test normalize-space without argument

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-1
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn-normalize-space function as per example 1 for this function from the Functions and Operators specs.
test-case.test: fn:normalize-space(" The wealthy curled darlings of our nation. ")

result.assert-string-value: The wealthy curled darlings of our nation.

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-2
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn-normalize-space function with no arguments and no context node.

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-3
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn-normalize-space function with argument containing one tab character.
test-case.test: fn:normalize-space("This text should contains no tabs")

result.assert-string-value: This text should contains no tabs

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-4
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn-normalize-space function with argument containing one newline character.
test-case.test: fn:normalize-space("This text should contains no newline characters.")

result.assert-string-value: This text should contains no newline characters.

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-5
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn-normalize-space function with argument containing multiple tab character.
test-case.test: fn:normalize-space("This text should contains no tab characters.")

result.assert-string-value: This text should contains no tab characters.

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-6
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn-normalize-space function with argument containing multiple newline characters.
test-case.test: fn:normalize-space("This text should contains no newline characters.")

result.assert-string-value: This text should contains no newline characters.

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-7
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn-normalize-space function with argument containing a tab and a newline characters.
test-case.test: fn:normalize-space("This text should contains no tabs or newline characters.")

result.assert-string-value: This text should contains no tabs or newline characters.

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-8
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn-normalize-space function with argument containing multiple tab and a newline characters.
test-case.test: fn:normalize-space("This text should contains no tabs or newline characters.")

result.assert-string-value: This text should contains no tabs or newline characters.

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-9
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn-normalize-space function with argument string containing only spaces. Use fn:count to avoid empty file

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-10
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn-normalize-space function with argument string containing only a single space. Use fn:count to avoid empty file

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-11
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn-normalize-space function with argument string containing the zero length string. Use fn:count to avoid empty file

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-12
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn-normalize-space function with argument string containing a single tab character. Use fn:count to avoid empty file

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-13
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn-normalize-space function with argument string containing only tab characters. Use fn:count to avoid empty file

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-14
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn-normalize-space function with argument string containing only a single newline character. Use fn:count to avoid empty file

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-15
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn-normalize-space function with argument string containing only multiple newline characters. Use fn:count to avoid empty file

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-16
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn-normalize-space function with argument string containing only spaces and tab characters. Use fn:count to avoid empty file

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-17
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn-normalize-space function with argument string containing only spaces and newline characters. Use fn:count to avoid empty file

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-18
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn-normalize-space function with argument string containing only tab and newline characters. Use fn:count to avoid empty file

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-19
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn-normalize-space function with argument string containing tabs and numerical characters. Use fn:count to avoid empty file

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-20
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn-normalize-space function with argument referencing fn:string function.

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-21
test-case.description: Evaluation of fn-normalize-space function with argument set to another fn:normalize-space function.

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-23
test-case.description: Evaluation of normalize-space applied to a node that cannot be atomized because it has element-only content. This succeeds, because although getting the typed value of such a node is an error, the string value is well defined, and normalize-space with no arguments uses the string value. Note, we assume construction from PSVI, therefore insignificant whitespace is stripped.

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-24
test-case.description: Evaluation of normalize-space applied to a node that cannot be atomized because it has element-only content. Unlike normalize-space-23, this fails, because when normalize-space() has an argument it atomizes the argument in the usual way.

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-25
test-case.description: Evaluation of normalize-space#0 when the context item is a date. Succeeds because the default argument is string(.) rather than .

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-26
test-case.description: Evaluation of normalize-space#1 when the context item is a date. Fails because the argument type is xs:string

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-26a
test-case.description: Evaluation of normalize-space#1 when the context item is a date. Fails because the argument type is xs:string

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-40
test-case.description: Call function with items other than strings.

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-41
test-case.description: Call function with items other than strings.

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-42
test-case.description: Call function with items other than strings.

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-43
test-case.description: Call function with items other than strings.

test-case.name: fn-normalize-space-44
test-case.description: Call function with items other than strings.

test-case.name: K-NormalizeSpaceFunc-1
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `normalize-space("a string", "wrong param")`.

test-case.name: K-NormalizeSpaceFunc-2
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `if(false()) then normalize-space() else true()`.

test-case.name: K-NormalizeSpaceFunc-3
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `normalize-space("foo") eq "foo"`.

test-case.name: K-NormalizeSpaceFunc-4
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `normalize-space(" foo") eq "foo"`.

test-case.name: K-NormalizeSpaceFunc-5
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `normalize-space("foo ") eq "foo"`.

test-case.name: K-NormalizeSpaceFunc-6
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `normalize-space(()) eq ""`.

test-case.name: K-NormalizeSpaceFunc-7
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `normalize-space("f o o ") eq "f o o"`.
test-case.test: normalize-space("f o o ") eq "f o o"

test-case.name: K-NormalizeSpaceFunc-8
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `normalize-space(" 143 1239 fhjkls ") eq "143 1239 fhjkls"`.

test-case.name: K-NormalizeSpaceFunc-9
test-case.description: Invoke normalize-space on itself. Implementations supporting the static typing feature may raise XPTY0004.
